trial_identification.studytitle: Effectiveness of a Wii Fit based exercise program in the management of chronic low back pain: a randomized clinical trial.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Effectiveness of a Wii Fit based exercise program in the management of chronic low back pain: a randomized clinical trial.

interventions.interventions: We'll suggest two different exercise programs to the treatment of low back pain. Wii fit program is based in some Wii Fit games such as warrior pose, ski slalom or single leg lift. To play this games you need to do some movements like flexion, extension and stretching of the low back muscles. 2 individual sessions per week will be made with a duration of 20 minutes, for 4 weeks. Sessions are conducted by a qualified physiotherapist. The program will be done at the hospital, so we can monitor adherence and also we can control that the exercises are done correctly.
interventions.comparator: Control treatment group will complete a conventional exercise program to the treatment of low back pain, based in low back movements like flexion and extension and the stretching of low back muscles. 3 group sessions per week will be made with a duration of 20 minutes, for 4 weeks. Sessions will be done at the hospital, so we can monitor adherence and also we can control that the exercises are done correctly. Sessions will be conducted by a qualified physiotherapist.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Pain, assessed by 100mm visual analogue scale (VAS)
primaryOutcome.timepoint: At the end of the treatment and 3 months later

primaryOutcome.outcome: Function, assessed using Roland-Morris Dissability Questionnarie (RMDQ) We will use the validated to spanish version
primaryOutcome.timepoint: At the end of the treatment and 3 months later

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Pain pressure threshold, assessed using a mechanical algometer
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: At the end of the treatment and 3 months later

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Kinesophobia, assessed using Tampa Scale of Kinesophobia (TSK-11 validated to the spanish version)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: At the end of the treatment and 3 months later

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Global perceived effect of treatment, assessed using an 11- point scale that ranged from -5 (vastly worse) through 0 (no change) to +5 (completely recovered)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: At the end of the treatment and 3 months later

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: - Non-specific low back pain diagnosis - Low back pain for at least 3 months - Give written informed voluntary consent
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: - Non-mechanical low back pain diagnosis - Any spinal surgery - Abdominal surgery within the last 12 months - Evidence of Cauda equina compression - Systemic illness - Radiculopathy or nerve root compression - Pysichiatric treatment

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Comparison between a traditional exercise program and an exercise program based on Wii Fit videogame in the treatment of low back pain
